example.text: Big, price-gouging corporations are padding their pockets and boosting their profits at the expense of hardworking American families. Unacceptable. [[url]]

Reps. Wild, Miller-Meeks Drum Up Support to Prevent Medicare Cuts "We write today as a bipartisan group of lawmakers urging you to act quickly to prevent the more than 8 percent cut in Medicare reimbursement that will directly impact patients in this country. Reducing Medicare payments by more than 8 percent, which comes on the heels of the 2 percent sequestration cut resuming earlier this year, would directly harm our nation's medical groups, physicians, hospitals, and other health care providers who care for our communities," wrote Reps. Wild, Miller-Meeks, and 113 of their colleagues.

Reps. Wild, Meuser Introduce Bill to Help Rural Hospitals "Without the Fairness for Rural Teaching Hospitals Act, 138 hospitals across the country would lose vital resources needed to deliver high-quality care to patients," said Rep. Wild. "As rural hospitals continue to face staffing shortages, this bill would ensure hospitals can continue to teach and train the next generation of rural health care workers."

This is a bill Congress must pass, one that has historically been overwhelmingly bipartisan-and so as one of the most bipartisan members of Congress, I've compromised across the aisle to pass an NDAA that supports ourmilitary and protects our national security. However, this year's bill was nothing like NDAAs of the past: it was hijacked by extreme DC Republicans who are playing politics with national security so they can pursue their agenda of banning abortion nationwide.

Reps. Wild, Meuser Introduce Bill to Help Rural Hospitals "Without the Fairness for Rural Teaching Hospitals Act, 138 hospitals across the country would lose vital resources needed to deliver high-quality care to patients," said Rep. Wild. "As rural hospitals continue to face staffing shortages, this bill would ensure hospitals can continue to teach and train the next generation of rural health care workers."

We are certainly united, and I'm reminded of that any time I speak to members of our region's Ukrainian-American community, which is one of the largest in the United States. Our support for Ukraine will not waver until its fight for freedom is won.
